meanings.definition: A short-lived, exotic atom composed of a positive muon and an electron.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study muonium to learn about exotic atoms.
meanings.sent2: Muonium is an interesting subject in the field of particle physics.
meanings.sent3: When muonium walked into the atomic party, everyone was amazed by its uniqueness.
meanings.sent4: The world of atoms was shaken when muonium made its grand entrance.
meanings.sent5: In the laboratory, muonium's short life teaches us valuable lessons about exotic particles.

meanings.definition: The lightest atom, consisting of a positive muon and an electron.
meanings.sent1: Muonium is the lightest atom known to scientists.
meanings.sent2: The properties of muonium make it a fascinating subject for research.
meanings.sent3: At the atomic weightlifting competition, muonium easily lifted the lightest atom trophy.
meanings.sent4: In the world of atoms, muonium shines as the featherweight champion.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, muonium's lightness is truly remarkable.
